From: Michael Rettig [mailto:mrettig@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 11, 2002 9:52 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Testing a class inside an Application Server



> I am trying to test a class that is supposed to run inside an
> Application Server context. This class will be used by EJBs and uses
> some of the resources offered by the Application Server, so it won't
> run outside de App Server. I would like to know what the best

We run out junit tests through a servlet interface that invokes the
testcases within the app server context. This way you have full access to
all the app server capabilities. The servlet is incredibly simple. It takes
a single parameter that is the name of the test class or suite to run. The
test is run within the servlet and xml is returned to the browser.

Many of our tests interact with the database, so I wrote a DatabaseTestCase
that starts a transaction in setup() and rolls it back in tearDown(). This
way the individual test case can interact with the database without ever
persisting anything.

Mike
